displaytitle: Bishop granting the rule of an order to two kneeling monks
medium: Black chalk with brush and red wash and pink-lavender gouache, squared on beige laid paper in red chalk
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
inscribed: Inscribed in brown ink, lower left, verso: d’Incontro/ 1.3; inscribed in brown ink, lower right, verso (blotted out with brown-gray wash): 892 1.3

titles.title: Bishop granting the rule of an order to two kneeling monks

texts.textentryhtml: George Clausen (Lugt 539) lower right; Dan Fellows Platt but without his marks

bibliography.boilertext: Nicholas Turner, "Review of "catalogue of Italian drawings in the Art Museum", Princeton University by Felton Gibbons," Art bulletin 62, no. 3 (Sept., 1980), p. 486-490.
bibliography.citation:
Nicholas Turner, "Review of "catalogue of Italian drawings in the Art Museum", Princeton University by Felton Gibbons," Art bulletin 62, no. 3 (Sept., 1980), p. 486-490.
, p. 489

displaymaker: Attributed to Sebastiano Folli, 1569-1622 | formerly Central Italian , circa 1600
caption: Attributed to Sebastiano Folli (1569-1622), formerly Central Italian, circa 1600, Bishop granting the rule of an order to two kneeling monks. Black chalk with brush and red wash and pink-lavender gouache, squared on beige laid paper in red chalk; 23.4 × 28.6 cm. Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-915)
